a.title: The Prep Charter 2020-2021 Freshmen Lottery Results

h4.span: Our mission is to promote a nurturing and challenging atmosphere where students will achieve high academic standards and develop essential career skills. We offer full support for English Language Learners,(ELL/ESL) and special education populations. The Preparatory Charter School of Mathematics, Science, Technology and Careers

a.class: vc_general vc_btn3 vc_btn3-size-lg vc_btn3-shape-square vc_btn3-style-custom vc_btn3-block
a.title: Mission

div.p: Prep Charter is a college preparatory charter school for students in grades 9-12, located in South Philadelphia.

div.class: efbl_fb_story efbl_ver_free halfwidth added_photos efbl_has_image efbl_

a.data-caption:
Today we would like to honor Aminata Dioubate from the Graduating Class of 2020.
You are simultaneously the product and the beginning of a legacy of brilliant women. Your intelligence and ambition coupled with your compassion provide you with the ability to truly impact the world in meaningful ways. I cannot wait to witness the path you will create! We love you, we are proud of you, and we will miss you. Congratulations, sweetie! xo -Ms. Junkerman

div.p:
Today we would like to honor Aminata Dioubate from the Graduating Class of 2020.
You are simultaneously the product and the beginning of a legacy of brilliant women. Your intelligence and ambition coupled with your compassion provide you with the ability to truly impact the world in meaningful ways. I cannot wait to witness the path you will create! We love you, we are proud of you, and we will miss you. Congratulations, sweetie! xo -Ms. Junkerman
Denise, I didn’t need to get past the first sentence to know you wrote that. Beautiful!

div.class: efbl_fb_story efbl_ver_free halfwidth added_photos efbl_has_image efbl_

a.data-caption:
Today we would like to honor Ty’Quez Hatton from the Graduating Class of 2020.
Ty'Quez!!I am so proud of you! The last few years you proved that you can overcome many obstacles. When I first met you, you were timid and shy but your amazing personality shined right through. Your bright smile lit up the hallways! Keep up the great work and be proud of all you have accomplished!! I will miss you my friend! -Nurse Burke

div.p:
Today we would like to honor Ty’Quez Hatton from the Graduating Class of 2020.
Ty'Quez!!I am so proud of you! The last few years you proved that you can overcome many obstacles. When I first met you, you were timid and shy but your amazing personality shined right through. Your bright smile lit up the hallways! Keep up the great work and be proud of all you have accomplished!! I will miss you my friend! -Nurse Burke

div.class: efbl_fb_story efbl_ver_free halfwidth added_photos efbl_has_image efbl_

a.data-caption:
Today we would like to honor Nashay Dickson from the Graduating Class of 2020.
Nashay, I remember being the first classroom that you joined at Prep. When I heard that a new student was joining mid-year, I wasn’t sure what to expect. You impressed me with your maturity and go-getter attitude from the first few minutes of knowing you. You continue to impress me with your ability to handle new tasks with grace. Your strong sense of self will take you far in whatever path you take, so continue to stay true to it!-Ms. Clemmer

div.p:
Today we would like to honor Nashay Dickson from the Graduating Class of 2020.
Nashay, I remember being the first classroom that you joined at Prep. When I heard that a new student was joining mid-year, I wasn’t sure what to expect. You impressed me with your maturity and go-getter attitude from the first few minutes of knowing you. You continue to impress me with your ability to handle new tasks with grace. Your strong sense of self will take you far in whatever path you take, so continue to stay true to it!-Ms. Clemmer

div.div: Copyright © 2020 The Preparatory Charter School. All rights reserved.
Education Hub Pro by WEN Themes

h3.span: If you are interested in borrowing a Chromebook from Prep Charter for the duration of this school year, you must complete the form below and report to Prep Charter to collect the Chromebook on Friday, April 24th between 9:00 am and 3:00 pm. This will be the last computer distribution date. This form must be submitted before noon this Thursday. If you do not complete the form prior to Thursday at noon, you will not be given a laptop on Friday. If you have any questions or concerns, you may reach out to Ms. Moore or Ms. Dembek.
Chromebook pick-up will be this Friday, April 24th from 9:00 am until 3:00 pm in the parking lot of Prep Charter High School. In order to avoid excessive lines, we ask that:
11th and 12th graders arrive between 9:00 am and 12:00 pm for pick up
9th and 10th graders arrive between 12:00 pm and 3:00 pm for pickup.

Students do not need to be present if a family member, other than the parent or guardian listed on this form, is designated to pick up the laptop, we ask that they present the student's ID as verification.

If arriving by car, you will remain in your vehicle and pull up to the distribution point as directed by our security staff. If you are walking, you will proceed to the walk-up line however, you must have a bag to transport the laptop home.
